events.1763: Suraj Mal Jat, Maharaja of Bharatpur, was killed by Najib-ud -Daulah s troops.
events.1771: Shah Alam II sat on the Throne of Dehli. Marathas captured Delhi and induced Shah Alam to return to Delhi after an absence of 18 years from the captial.
events.1861: Pandit Madan Mohan Malaviya, freedom fighter and founder of Banaras Hindu University, was born at Allahabad.
events.1876: Mohamad Ali Jinnah, the founder of Pakistan, was born.
events.1879: Sadhu T.L. Vaswani (1879-1966), altruistic Sindhi poet and servant of God, who found several Hindu missions in India and seven Mira Educational Institutions in his lifetime, was born.
events.1880: Dr. Mukhtar Ahmed Ansari, a nationalist Muslim leader, politician and journalist, was born at Yusufpur in Uttar Pradesh.
events.1889: Pandurangi Kodanda Rao, journalist, Hindi writer and social worker, was born in Visakhapatnam, A.P.
events.1919: Naushad, famous film music director, was born.
events.1921: Mass boycott greets the Prince of Wales when he arrives in Calcutta.
events.1924: Atal Krishna Behari Bajpayee, Prime Minister of India and a veteran journalist, was born at Gwalior, Madhya Pradesh.
events.1926: Dharmavir Bharti, journalist and editor of Dharmyug, was born. His famous books are "Gunahon Ka Devta" and "Suraj Ka Satwa Ghoda".
events.1932: King George V's chair collapsed during his Christmas dinner speech.
events.1936: Ismail Merchant, producer (Householder), was born in Bombay, India.
events.1937: Pitambar Datt Kaushika, great educationist, was born at Bulandshahar.
events.1946: Gandhiji said, at Noakhali, "I am being tested through and through".
events.1949: Dr. Hari Singh Gour, famous law expert, great social reformer, jurist, leader and educationist, passed away.
events.1964: Anil Kaul, Canadian badminton player (Olympics-96), was born in Amritsar, India.
events.1969: India all out for 163 at Madras vs Australia, Ashley Mallett takes 5-91.
events.1972: Chakravarti Rajagopalachari, great revolutionary freedom fighter, social worker, eminent litterateur, first Indian Governor General and the founder President of Swatantra Party, passed away.
events.1974: Indian Aeroplane Jumbo 747 was hijacked and taken over to Rome.
events.1979: Opening day of Fourth Test Cricket, India 8-112 v Pakistan at Kanpur.
events.1991: Ajit Singh expelled from the JD.
events.1994: Giani Zail Singh, former President of India, died in Chandigarh at the age of 78.
events.1995: First major multi-organ transplant in the country performed in Apollo Hospital in Madras.
events.1997: India-Sri Lanka one-day cricket match at Indore abandoned after three overs owing to a bad state of the pitch, which was a rare occurance.
events.1999: An Indian Airlines aircraft with 187 passengers on board is hijacked. The plane was going from Katmandu to New Delhi. It lands near Abu Dhabi after several hops.
events.2000: A. B. Vajpayee, Prime Minister, launches a Rs.60,000 crore ''Gram Sadak Yojana''  for linking all villages and the "Antyodaya Anna Scheme''  for providing cheap foodgrains under the TPDS.
